A Data Manifest for Contextualized Telemetry Data A Data Manifest for Contextualized Telemetry Data
draft-ietf-opsawg-collected-data-manifest-09 draft-ietf-opsawg-collected-data-manifest-10
Abstract Abstract
Network platforms use Network Telemetry, such as YANG-Push, to Network platforms use Network Telemetry, such as YANG-Push, to
continuously stream information, including both counters and state continuously stream information, including both counters and state
information. This document describes the metadata that ensure that information. This document describes the metadata that ensure that
the collected data can be interpreted correctly. This document the collected data can be interpreted correctly. This document
specifies the data manifest, composed of two YANG data models (the specifies the Data Manifest, composed of two YANG data models (the
platform manifest and the non-normative data collection manifest). Platform Manifest and the non-normative Data Collection Manifest).
These YANG modules are specified at the network level (e.g., network These YANG modules are specified at the network level (e.g., network
controllers) to provide a model that encompasses several network controllers) to provide a model that encompasses several network
platforms. The data manifest must be streamed and stored along with platforms. The Data Manifest must be streamed and stored along with
the data, up to the collection and analytics systems to keep the the data, up to the collection and analytics systems to keep the
collected data fully exploitable by the data scientists and relevant collected data fully exploitable by the data scientists and relevant
tools. Additionally, this document specifies an augmentation of the tools. Additionally, this document specifies an augmentation of the
YANG-Push model to include the actual collection period, in case it YANG-Push model to include the actual collection period, in case it
differs from the configured collection period. differs from the configured collection period.

1. Introduction 1. Introduction
Network platforms use Network Telemetry, such as YANG-Push [RFC8641], Network platforms use Network Telemetry, such as YANG-Push [RFC8641],
to continuously stream information, including both counters and state to continuously stream information, including both counters and state
information. information.
This document specifies what needs to be kept as metadata to ensure This document specifies what needs to be kept as metadata to ensure
that the collected data can still be interpreted correctly throughout that the collected data can still be interpreted correctly throughout
the collection and network analytics toolchain. When streaming YANG- the collection and network analytics toolchain. When streaming YANG-
structured data with YANG-Push, there is a semantic definition in the structured data with YANG-Push, there is a semantic definition in the
corresponding YANG module definition. This is the semantic corresponding YANG module definition. This is the semantic
information for the collected data nodes: While this semantic is information for the collected data nodes: While this semantic is
absolutely required to correctly decode and interpret the data, absolutely required to correctly decode and interpret the data,
understanding the network platform and collection environment understanding the network platform and collection environment
contexts information is equally important to interpret the data. contexts information is equally important to interpret the data.
One part of this information is the actual collection period, as One part of this information is the actual collection period, as
opposed to the configured collection period. On some platforms, that opposed to the configured collection period. On some platforms, that
period can be adjusted automatically by the platform, for instance to period can be adjusted unilaterally by the platform, for instance to
reduce the load incurred by sending the telemetry. To later exploit reduce the load incurred by sending the telemetry. To later exploit
the collected data, getting this actual collection period is crucial. the collected data, getting this actual collection period is crucial.
This document defines a YANG model augmenting the YANG-Push model This document defines a YANG model augmenting the YANG-Push model
[RFC8641] to expose the actual collection period in Section 4. [RFC8641] to expose the actual collection period in Section 4.
This document introduces the data manifest, which is composed of two This document introduces the Data Manifest, which is composed of two
YANG modules, namely, the platform manifest and the data collection YANG modules, namely, the Platform Manifest and the data collection
manifest, to keep the collected data exploitable by the data manifest, to keep the collected data exploitable by the data
scientists and relevant tools. scientists and relevant tools.
The platform manifest contains information characterizing the The Platform Manifest contains information characterizing the
platform streaming the telemetry information, while the data platform streaming the telemetry information, while the Data
collection manifest contains the required information to characterize Collection Manifest contains the required information to characterize
how and when the telemetry information was metered. The platform how and when the telemetry information was metered. The Platform
manifest is specified in Section 5. An example of data collection Manifest is specified in Section 5. An example of Data Collection
manifest is specified in Section 6. The latter module is non- Manifest is specified in Section 6. The latter module is non-
normative due to the lack of design-time schema mount in YANG, see normative due to the lack of design-time schema mount in YANG, see
Section 1 of [RFC8528]. Section 1 of [RFC8528].
These two YANG modules do not expose any new information but rather These two YANG modules do not expose any new information but rather
define what should be exposed by a platform streaming or storing define what should be exposed by a platform streaming or storing
telemetry data. Some related YANG modules have been specified to telemetry data. Some related YANG modules have been specified to
retrieve the platform capabilities such as: retrieve the platform capabilities such as:
* "YANG Library" [RFC8525]. * "YANG Library" [RFC8525].

streamed data. streamed data.
This document covers only metadata about the collection context for This document covers only metadata about the collection context for
the telemetry. The collected data is likely to be transformed into the telemetry. The collected data is likely to be transformed into
usable indicators for the network. The list of such transformation usable indicators for the network. The list of such transformation
operations applied to the data is often called data lineage. operations applied to the data is often called data lineage.
Supplying the data lineage for the computed indicators is out of Supplying the data lineage for the computed indicators is out of
scope of this document. scope of this document.

collected, three elements are necessary: the time of data emission, piece of data was collected, without having to access the platform

focusing on providing a way to match a platform and a subscription in this document assumes that an underlying database records the
identifier to the collection context. This is consistent with most history of both the data and the Data Manifest, enabling the data
of the YANG modules for devices, which focus on describing the analyst to temporally match the data and the Data Manifest.
current state of the device, rather than the evolution of that state Therefore, the approach presented here focuses on providing a way to
through time. match a platform and a subscription identifier to the collection
context. This is consistent with most of the YANG modules for

2. Terminology 2. Terminology
The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT",
"SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "NOT RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "NOT RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and
"OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in BCP "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in BCP
14 [RFC2119] [RFC8174] when, and only when, they appear in all 14 [RFC2119] [RFC8174] when, and only when, they appear in all
capitals, as shown here. capitals, as shown here.
This document reuses the term "Network Telemetry" as defined in This document reuses the term "Network Telemetry" as defined in
[RFC9232]. [RFC9232].
Platform: equipment of the network able to produce telemetry data. Platform: equipment in the network able to produce telemetry data.
Data manifest: The necessary data required to interpret telemetry Data Manifest: The necessary data required to interpret telemetry
information. information.
Platform manifest: part of the data manifest that completely Platform Manifest: part of the Data Manifest that characterizes the
characterizes the platform producing the telemetry information. platform producing the telemetry information.
Data collection manifest: part of the data manifest that completely Data Collection Manifest: part of the Data Manifest that
characterizes how and when the telemetry information was metered. characterizes how and when the telemetry information was metered.
Datapoint: an instance of data collected via Network Telemetry at a Datapoint: an instance of data collected via Network Telemetry at a
specific time. specific time.
Collector: software that receives the stream of telemetry. Collector: software that receives the stream of telemetry.

3.2. New Device Onboarding 3.2. New Device Onboarding
When a new device is onboarded, operators must check that the new When a new device is onboarded, operators must check that the new
device streams data (e.g., with YANG-Push), that the Network device streams data (e.g., with YANG-Push), that the Network
Telemetry data is the right one, that the data is correctly collected Telemetry data is the right one, that the data is correctly collected
at the data collection, and finally that the data can be analyzed at the data collection, and finally that the data can be analyzed
(compared with other similar devices). For the last point, the data (compared with other similar devices). For the last point, the Data
manifest, which must be linked to the data up to the collection and Manifest, which must be linked to the data up to the collection and
analytics system, contains the relevant information. analytics system, contains the relevant information, notably in the
case where the telemetry subscriptions are not configured by the
telemetry collectors.
3.3. Data Mesh Principles in Networking 3.3. Data Mesh Principles in Networking
The concept behind the data mesh [DataMesh] are: The concept behind the data mesh [DataMesh] are:
* Domain Ownership: Architecturally and organizationally align * Domain Ownership: Architecturally and organizationally align
business, technology, and analytical data, following the line of business, technology, and analytical data, following the line of
responsibility. The Data Mesh principles adopt the boundary of responsibility. The Data Mesh principles adopt the boundary of
bounded context to individual data products where each domain is bounded context to individual data products where each domain is
responsible for (and owns) its data and models. responsible for (and owns) its data and models.
skipping to change at page 7, line 6 ¶ skipping to change at page 7, line 10 ¶
the "Domain Ownership" principle. the "Domain Ownership" principle.
* Self-serve Data Platform: This fosters the sharing of cross-domain * Self-serve Data Platform: This fosters the sharing of cross-domain
data to create extra value. data to create extra value.
* Federated Computational Governance: Describes the operating model * Federated Computational Governance: Describes the operating model
and approach to establishing global policies across a mesh of data and approach to establishing global policies across a mesh of data
products. products.
The most relevant concept for this document is the "Data as a The most relevant concept for this document is the "Data as a
Product" principle. The data manifest fulfills this principle as the Product" principle. The Data Manifest fulfills this principle as the
two YANG data models, platform manifest and the data collection two YANG data models, Platform Manifest and the Data Collection
manifest, along with the data, provide all the necessary information Manifest, along with the data, provide all the necessary information
in a self-describing way for easy consumption. in a self-describing way for easy consumption.
4. The "ietf-yp-current-period" YANG module 4. The "ietf-yp-current-period" YANG module
Some platforms will adjust the collection period depending on their Some platforms will adjust the collection period depending on their
capabilities and current load. The YANG module in this section capabilities and current load. The YANG module in this section
augments the "ietf-subscribed-notification" module to provide the augments the "ietf-subscribed-notification" module to provide the
"current-period" leaf. The value of this leaf indicates the current "current-period" leaf. The value of this leaf indicates the current
collection which might be different from the configured collection collection period which might be different from the configured
period. collection period.

current-period" module. current-period" module.

7. Data Manifest and the Collected Data 7. Data Manifest and the Collected Data
This section focuses on associating the collected data to the data This section focuses on associating the collected data to the Data
manifest. As this document specifically focuses on giving context on Manifest. As this document specifically focuses on giving context on
data collected via Network Telemetry, it is assumed that a Network data collected via Network Telemetry, it is assumed that a Network
Telemetry system is available. Another premise of this document is Telemetry system is available. Another premise of this document is
the storage of the collected data into a database for later the storage of the collected data into a database for later
exploitation. This document assumes that such a database exists and exploitation. This document assumes that such a database exists and
can be used for storing the data manifest. can be used for storing the Data Manifest.
7.1. Collecting the Data Manifest 7.1. Collecting the Data Manifest
The data manifest MUST be streamed and stored along with the The Data Manifest MUST be streamed and stored along with the
collected data. In case the collected data are moved to a different collected data. In case the collected data are moved to a different
place (typically a database), the companion data manifest MUST follow place (typically a database), the companion Data Manifest MUST follow
the collected data. Storing the collected data without the companion the collected data. Storing the collected data without the companion
data manifest might prevent the correct interpretation of the Data Manifest might prevent the correct interpretation of the
collected data. The data manifest MUST be updated when the data collected data. The Data Manifest MUST be updated when the Data
manifest information changes, for example, when a router is upgraded, Manifest information changes, for example, when a router is upgraded,
when a new Network Telemetry subscription is configured, or when the when a new Network Telemetry subscription is configured, or when the
Network Telemetry subscription parameters change. The data manifest Network Telemetry subscription parameters change. The Data Manifest
can itself be considered as a time series, and stored in a similar can itself be considered as a time series, and stored in a similar
fashion to the collected data. fashion to the collected data.
This document recommends reusing existing Network Telemetry systems This document recommends reusing existing Network Telemetry systems
(in-band approach) to lower the efforts for implementing this (in-band approach) to lower the efforts for implementing this
approach. To enable a platform supporting Network Telemetry to also approach. To enable a platform supporting Network Telemetry to also
support the data manifest, it is sufficient that this platform support the Data Manifest, it is sufficient that this platform
supports the models from Sections 5 and 6. The collection of the supports the models from Sections 5 and 6. The collection of the
data manifest MUST be explicitly configured by the collector by Data Manifest MUST be explicitly configured by the collector by
requesting the relevant subscriptions. These subscriptions MUST requesting the relevant subscriptions. These subscriptions MUST
include the platform manifest and the data collection manifest, include the Platform Manifest and the Data Collection Manifest,
possibly limited to the subscriptions for which the context needs to possibly limited to the subscriptions for which the context needs to
be retrieved a posteriori. Appendix B shows how the in-band approach be retrieved a posteriori. Appendix B shows how the in-band approach
would work while storing to a time series database. would work while storing to a time series database.

reboot for the platform manifest and when subscriptions are modified reboot for the Platform Manifest and when subscriptions are modified
for the data collection manifest. The data manifest SHOULD be for the Data Collection Manifest. The Data Manifest SHOULD be
streamed with the YANG-Push on-change feature [RFC8641] (also called streamed with the YANG-Push on-change feature [RFC8641] (also called
event-driven telemetry) whenever possible. event-driven telemetry) whenever possible.

is updated. Thus, the platform manifest only needs to be collected is updated. Thus, the Platform Manifest only needs to be collected

7.2. Mapping Collected Data to the Data Manifest 7.2. Mapping Collected Data to the Data Manifest
As explained in the introduction, three elements are necessary to As explained in the introduction, three elements are necessary to
identify the data manifest associated to a datapoint: identify the Data Manifest associated to a datapoint:
* the time at which the data was sent from the device, * the time at which the data was sent from the device,
* the originating platform sending the data, and * the originating platform sending the data, and
* the identifier of the subscription that produced the data. * the identifier of the subscription that produced the data.
These elements can be either known to the collector, if it is the one These elements can be either known to the collector, if it is the one
configuring the collection, or retrieved via dedicated headers as configuring the collection, or retrieved via dedicated headers as
proposed, e.g., in [I-D.netana-netconf-notif-envelope]. To enable a proposed, e.g., in [I-D.netana-netconf-notif-envelope]. To enable a
posteriori retrieval of the data manifest associated to a datapoint, posteriori retrieval of the Data Manifest associated to a datapoint,
the collector MUST keep the subscription identifier and platform the collector MUST keep the subscription identifier and platform
identifier in the metadata of the collected values. identifier in the metadata of the collected values.
With these three elements, to retrieve the data manifest from a With these three elements, to retrieve the Data Manifest from a
datapoint, the following happens: datapoint, the following happens:
* The subscription identifier, platform identifier and timestamp of * The subscription identifier, platform identifier and timestamp of
the data are retrieved from the datapoint metadata the data are retrieved from the datapoint metadata

the latest version before the timestamp matching the platform the latest version before the timestamp matching the platform
identifier. identifier.
* The data collection manifest for that datapoint is obtained by * The Data Collection Manifest for that datapoint is obtained by
looking up the latest version before the timestamp matching the looking up the latest version before the timestamp matching the
platform identifier and the subscription identifier. platform identifier and the subscription identifier.
